page.title: 08CHANGE IN WORSLEY SINCE 1945
page.content: CHANGES SINCE 1945,WORSLEY During this time many more houses have been built in the area.Roads like Maple Grove,Duchy Avenue and Bedford Avenue were open fields.The linear parkway was a busy railway line with steam trains running on it.People burnt coal in their homes on open fires so the atmosphere was much dirtier. Mesne Lea and James Brindley Primary Schools have been built to cater for the increased number of children in the area.St. George's High School has also been built.The old St. Paul's Primary School opposite the new library has been demolished and moved to another site. A new Worsley Pool has been built and the old one made into two teaching pools.Worsley Town Hall is now used by N.W.Regional advisory College.
